column1: Today we celebrate the re-entry of the #Dragon space crew and we remember Kalpana Chawla (1962-2003) the 1st Indian-American woman to go to space. She was an astronaut/engineer. She died in 2003 on her second mission to space with 7 other heroic crew members. #AAPIHeritageMonth https://t.co/hA0g6bEfUV

This #AAPIHeritageMonth is a big one for me because I‚Äôve been working through a lot of racial identity and antiracism stuff.  For a long time
column2: I hated identifying as Asian American
column3: not because I was ashamed necessarily
column4: but because being labeled and stereotyped as ‚ÄúAsian‚Äù hurt.

column1: When I began unpacking all this in August
column2: I called myself a reluctant Asian American.  Reflecting on this #AAPIHeritageMonth
column3: I no longer feel reluctant. I have always been and continue to be fiercely proud of my roots. Now I can also say I‚Äôm proud to be called #AAPI too.
